head.title: A Mixed Message From the Vatican

hedline.hl1: A Mixed Message From the Vatican

abstract.p: International Jewish Committee for Interreligious Consultations chmn Seymour D Reich letter urges Vatican to issue statement clarifying confusing mixed message on church's relations with world's other religions

block.p: You report (news article, Sept. 20) that Pope John Paul II recently said that ''the commitment of the Catholic Church to ecumenical dialogue is irrevocable.''
You report (news article, Sept. 20) that Pope John Paul II recently said that ''the commitment of the Catholic Church to ecumenical dialogue is irrevocable.''

This statement appears to conflict sharply with the document issued by Cardinal Joseph Ratzinger, the director of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith, declaring that non-Christian religions ''are in a gravely deficient situation in comparison with those who in the church have the fullness of the means of salvation.''

The slighting of other faiths can only undermine the important progress made in interfaith relations since the Second Vatican Council. What is needed is a statement from the Vatican clarifying a confusing mixed message on the church's relations with the world's other religions.
SEYMOUR D. REICH New York, Sept. 20, 2000
The writer is chairman, International Jewish Committee for Interreligious Consultations.
